body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

title: Ruqqus 2.27 - Improved Content Filtering, Guildmaster Tools, and Mod Queue

Oh well. Sucks for those pieces of shit.

body:
Political guilds are hidden by default, and while I don't necessarily disagree with this decision (the far-right-ish politics here can be rather off-putting), it's not entirely clear just by looking at /all. Perhaps there should be a short description above the list of categories. "Guilds are sorted into different categories, which are self-selected. You can customize your feed by choosing which categories you want to see. Political guilds are hidden by default."

Edit: I'm copying and pasting my comments into the feedback thread.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

body:
I didn't see the point of making a new post in +BetaFeedback for such a small thing, but something I would like is a quick option to filter out guilds that you've already joined in https://ruqqus.com/browse. If I'm looking for new ones to join, it saves time. For now, I'm making do with this uBlock rule that I enable when needed:
`ruqqus.com##div[id^="board-"]:if(> .card-footer > div[id^="button-sub-"][class="d-none"]):upward(1)`
body_html: I didn't see the point of making a new post in +BetaFeedback for such a small thing, but something I would like is a quick option to filter out guilds that you've already joined in https://ruqqus.com/browse. * Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

body:
>edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

Dumb rule that needs to be changed because it means there's no point posting something in +Mongolia because it has an inactive mod and it's not worth my time to siege the guild - but it will never be noticed since anything I post there will never show up to anyone. +Iran has no guildmaster, same problem - never WILL have a guildmaster since nobody will find it if my posts of Iranian news stories there never show up in All/Trending.

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.
body_html:
edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

Dumb rule that needs to be changed because it means there's no point posting something in +Mongolia because it has an inactive mod and it's not worth my time to siege the guild - but it will never be noticed since anything I post there will never show up to anyone. +Iran has no guildmaster, same problem - never WILL have a guildmaster since nobody will find it if my posts of Iranian news stories there never show up in All/Trending.

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.

body:
I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site. 

Not worth the bullshit of "Oh but admins woke up today and said because of the news story they read about, they're going to turn off the ability for new people to join, and start limiting what can appear in all/trending based on the activity level of the person who created the guild in which you're trying to post - so somebody like Klenvastargan who sits online all day will totally dominate and you'll just never again see anything from +dolphins"

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.
body_html:
I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site.

This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

body:
Here's the problem with your dumbshit mandatory-Categorization idea, +Tennis adopted it and thus I can get karma and attract discussion if I post there, but +Golf has a barely-active GM and somebody asking for months for it to be replaced but the 12 members there are also inactive...it won't ever grow because even if I post a great story there, it won't be shown on All/Trending, so nobody sees it, nobody joins it, nobody becomes GM of it

If you want it to be "mandatory", just make a dialogue box that will prompt the GM next time they log into the site, and provide them the dropdown menus to choose categories. Don't remove all possible purpose to ordinary users posting in +Iran or +Golf or +Dolphins just because they aren't modded by the right power-mods.

Check out my username for additional irony. Don't make this a Reddit shithole.

body:
The admins are probably using you as a test subject for various CSS and javascript concepts. This is a normal thing in the "biz" and you should have the console open in a new window all the time because when they change something for you it will show up as an alert in the console. 

To view the console, hit F12 on your keyboard. If you can't use keyboard shortcuts, it should be in the browser's menu. Look up: "how to view <browser> developer console". 

I can tell that your comments are getting special treatment... pathetic.

body:
How soon is "soon"? Please add a message saying /all is NOT /all on mobile because it's not /all. It's a filtered version of /all with only categorized guilds, and the end users need to know that. It's clearer on desktop (not really) since you can see the categories right in the sidebar, but on mobile, there's no indication that /all is filtering out uncategorized guilds.

Edit: I retract my statement about the desktop site. There should be an indication on both desktop and mobile.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

It's clearer on desktop (not really) since you can see the categories right in the sidebar, but on mobile, there's no indication that /all is filtering out uncategorized guilds.

Edit: I retract my statement about the desktop site. There should be an indication on both desktop and mobile.

parent.body:
Political guilds are hidden by default, and while I don't necessarily disagree with this decision (the far-right-ish politics here can be rather off-putting), it's not entirely clear just by looking at /all. Perhaps there should be a short description above the list of categories. "Guilds are sorted into different categories, which are self-selected. You can customize your feed by choosing which categories you want to see. Political guilds are hidden by default."

Edit: I'm copying and pasting my comments into the feedback thread.

body: Yeah this rule kinda  breaks ruqqus

parent.body:
>edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

Dumb rule that needs to be changed because it means there's no point posting something in +Mongolia because it has an inactive mod and it's not worth my time to siege the guild - but it will never be noticed since anything I post there will never show up to anyone. +Iran has no guildmaster, same problem - never WILL have a guildmaster since nobody will find it if my posts of Iranian news stories there never show up in All/Trending.

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

parent.body:
I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site. 

Not worth the bullshit of "Oh but admins woke up today and said because of the news story they read about, they're going to turn off the ability for new people to join, and start limiting what can appear in all/trending based on the activity level of the person who created the guild in which you're trying to post - so somebody like Klenvastargan who sits online all day will totally dominate and you'll just never again see anything from +dolphins"

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

parent.body:
So can people only see content now by opting in? That means people will never be exposed to content they don’t know about. 

People should be exposed to other ideas. Otherwise people only become more insular.

  • Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

body:
This may be an unpopular opinion that goes against the ethos of Ruqqus as a whole, but I really think that Voat is going to present an existential crisis to this website. **You need to greatly limit, if not outright ban hate speech from this website. Hate speech is morally repugnant, just like content sexualising minors, and the latter is banned from this site - and rightly so.**

If you allow Voat refugees to flock to this site unabated, you are going to have much bigger problems than just Patreon deplatforming the site. Ruqqus Premium will end up failing because Paypal will end up blacklisting you. Stripe and other payment processers will refuse to work with you too. You'll literally be forced to use Bitcoin, Ethereum or whatever other crypto shitcoin is hot to take payments for premium subscriptions - and cryptocurrency is far from an ideal solution due to its price volatility and the tech-savviness required to use it.

A lot of people were also turned away from Voat because about 90% of the comments in the main subverses were filled with racist and homophobic slurs spouted by hardcore white supremacists. Heck, as somebody who registered on Voat back in alpha (when Ellen Pao was still CEO of Reddit Inc), the sheer toxicity of that community almost made me consider deleting my account because I simply didn't want to associate myself with such a racist shithole.

Please don't let Ruqqus share the same fate. Let these people flock elsewhere. They should not be welcome on this site unless they change their ways. These are people who stretch the absolute limits of free speech to the point where they make you question whether the First Amendment was a mistake.

Tags are a much better system.

body: Maybe the hate speech filter could just be enabled by default. Freedom only to speak inoffensively is not worth having. Also, decentralized stablecoins on the ETH chain like DAI could just be used if payment processors drop us. Those would be no more than minor inconveniences

parent.body:
This may be an unpopular opinion that goes against the ethos of Ruqqus as a whole, but I really think that Voat is going to present an existential crisis to this website. **You need to greatly limit, if not outright ban hate speech from this website. Hate speech is morally repugnant, just like content sexualising minors, and the latter is banned from this site - and rightly so.**

If you allow Voat refugees to flock to this site unabated, you are going to have much bigger problems than just Patreon deplatforming the site. Ruqqus Premium will end up failing because Paypal will end up blacklisting you. Stripe and other payment processers will refuse to work with you too. You'll literally be forced to use Bitcoin, Ethereum or whatever other crypto shitcoin is hot to take payments for premium subscriptions - and cryptocurrency is far from an ideal solution due to its price volatility and the tech-savviness required to use it.

A lot of people were also turned away from Voat because about 90% of the comments in the main subverses were filled with racist and homophobic slurs spouted by hardcore white supremacists. Heck, as somebody who registered on Voat back in alpha (when Ellen Pao was still CEO of Reddit Inc), the sheer toxicity of that community almost made me consider deleting my account because I simply didn't want to associate myself with such a racist shithole.

Please don't let Ruqqus share the same fate. Let these people flock elsewhere. They should not be welcome on this site unless they change their ways. These are people who stretch the absolute limits of free speech to the point where they make you question whether the First Amendment was a mistake.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

body:
Kinda defeats the purpose of sharing things really. 

I don’t support the efforts to overcustomize site viewing. I believe a big part of the importance and use of free speech is being open to other ideas and coming across things outside your perspective. Civil society exists on civil discussion. So I think it’s a shame that Ruqqus policy isn’t encouraging that in the way it presents itself. 

I’ve said it before, I have friends and people I can talk to that think the same as me and it’s not stressful like being here. But I came here to be open to talking to others and to share my perspective. But if other people can’t even see things outside their interests than what’s the point? All should be all. If you want to see all content you should see all content. Home was supposed to be your curated feed. 

Ruqqus may end up just being factions of drama guilds.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site. 

Not worth the bullshit of "Oh but admins woke up today and said because of the news story they read about, they're going to turn off the ability for new people to join, and start limiting what can appear in all/trending based on the activity level of the person who created the guild in which you're trying to post - so somebody like Klenvastargan who sits online all day will totally dominate and you'll just never again see anything from +dolphins"

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.

parent.body:
This may be an unpopular opinion that goes against the ethos of Ruqqus as a whole, but I really think that Voat is going to present an existential crisis to this website. **You need to greatly limit, if not outright ban hate speech from this website. Hate speech is morally repugnant, just like content sexualising minors, and the latter is banned from this site - and rightly so.**

If you allow Voat refugees to flock to this site unabated, you are going to have much bigger problems than just Patreon deplatforming the site. Ruqqus Premium will end up failing because Paypal will end up blacklisting you. Stripe and other payment processers will refuse to work with you too. You'll literally be forced to use Bitcoin, Ethereum or whatever other crypto shitcoin is hot to take payments for premium subscriptions - and cryptocurrency is far from an ideal solution due to its price volatility and the tech-savviness required to use it.

A lot of people were also turned away from Voat because about 90% of the comments in the main subverses were filled with racist and homophobic slurs spouted by hardcore white supremacists. Heck, as somebody who registered on Voat back in alpha (when Ellen Pao was still CEO of Reddit Inc), the sheer toxicity of that community almost made me consider deleting my account because I simply didn't want to associate myself with such a racist shithole.

Please don't let Ruqqus share the same fate. Let these people flock elsewhere. They should not be welcome on this site unless they change their ways. These are people who stretch the absolute limits of free speech to the point where they make you question whether the First Amendment was a mistake.

parent.body:
>edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

Dumb rule that needs to be changed because it means there's no point posting something in +Mongolia because it has an inactive mod and it's not worth my time to siege the guild - but it will never be noticed since anything I post there will never show up to anyone. +Iran has no guildmaster, same problem - never WILL have a guildmaster since nobody will find it if my posts of Iranian news stories there never show up in All/Trending.

Basically this rule, as it stands, will drastically increase the echo-chamber and reduce us to a few power-guilds while all of the old guilds with fewer than 500 members will not even be worth TRYING to build up unless you ARE the moderator. But if you're not the moderator, and nobody's a super-active mod who is changing settings (what percentage of guilds even have a banner set?) then there's no point even POSTING in it.

I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site. 

Not worth the bullshit of "Oh but admins woke up today and said because of the news story they read about, they're going to turn off the ability for new people to join, and start limiting what can appear in all/trending based on the activity level of the person who created the guild in which you're trying to post - so somebody like Klenvastargan who sits online all day will totally dominate and you'll just never again see anything from +dolphins"

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.

I think free speech died on Ruqqus today, seriously considering quitting the site.

Not worth the bullshit of "Oh but admins woke up today and said because of the news story they read about, they're going to turn off the ability for new people to join, and start limiting what can appear in all/trending based on the activity level of the person who created the guild in which you're trying to post - so somebody like Klenvastargan who sits online all day will totally dominate and you'll just never again see anything from +dolphins"

At worst, it's outright censorship - at "best" it's an attempt to monetize the site for power-users to dominate the narrative. Either way, it's losing my interest quickly.

post.body:
This is the first in a series of updates that we are accelerating due to the impending death of Voat.

* Trending/All now feature content filtering options, which are available to both logged-in and logged-out viewers. Guildmasters: be sure to select a category in guild settings so that your guild can be shown to interested users.*

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

parent.body:
This may be an unpopular opinion that goes against the ethos of Ruqqus as a whole, but I really think that Voat is going to present an existential crisis to this website. **You need to greatly limit, if not outright ban hate speech from this website. Hate speech is morally repugnant, just like content sexualising minors, and the latter is banned from this site - and rightly so.**

If you allow Voat refugees to flock to this site unabated, you are going to have much bigger problems than just Patreon deplatforming the site. Ruqqus Premium will end up failing because Paypal will end up blacklisting you. Stripe and other payment processers will refuse to work with you too. You'll literally be forced to use Bitcoin, Ethereum or whatever other crypto shitcoin is hot to take payments for premium subscriptions - and cryptocurrency is far from an ideal solution due to its price volatility and the tech-savviness required to use it.

A lot of people were also turned away from Voat because about 90% of the comments in the main subverses were filled with racist and homophobic slurs spouted by hardcore white supremacists. Heck, as somebody who registered on Voat back in alpha (when Ellen Pao was still CEO of Reddit Inc), the sheer toxicity of that community almost made me consider deleting my account because I simply didn't want to associate myself with such a racist shithole.

Please don't let Ruqqus share the same fate. Let these people flock elsewhere. They should not be welcome on this site unless they change their ways. These are people who stretch the absolute limits of free speech to the point where they make you question whether the First Amendment was a mistake.

* Guildmasters now have faster access to the Exile button via the dropdowns on posts and comments. Now you don't have to go into guild settings.

* Two bugs in offtopic reporting have been fixed. These came in from the original Heroku migration, and offtopic reports works again.

We've set up signups to allow new users to register at a limited rate. This will allow us to begin absorbing some of the load from Voat without getting completely overwhelmed.

---

edit: Guilds won't be shown in All/Trending until they pick a category.

edit 2: @arkitekt has a categorization feedback/suggestion thread [here](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/5yxy/category-suggestions)

body:
I'm not personally triggered by such comments.

The issue is that anybody who provides the tech necessary to take payments will take one look at Ruqqus and realise it's a liability to support such a website. This is exactly what Paypal and Stripe did to both Voat and Gab.

Cancel culture is basically the reason why we cannot have true freedom of speech and expression online. That being said I'd rather see a more open, friendlier and less power-trippy alternative to Reddit flourish than see Voat refugees taint another social news site with their overt racism and xenophobia. Because that shit is going to drag Ruqqus down.

Any topic about Voat was moved to a sub about Voat where it would get zero visibility. Then they started fucking with the voting system which encouraged brigading. I was finally banned when I mocked them for divorcing Voat yet their front page was full of Voat's material and it was days old posts. How did they remedy it? Hide the downvotes and post age. It's shit.
